title: Key Words: Facebook still not doing enough to prevent ethnic hate in Myanmar, U.N. investigator says
text: Facebook Inc. has admitted it did not do enough to prevent the incitement of ethnic violence in Myanmar nearly two years ago, but it still has not taken enough steps to stop the spread of hate on its platform, a United Nations investigator says.

title: Instagram Shopping Could Soon Be a $10 Billion Business
text: E-commerce and ads will create a virtuous cycle.

title: Finding Facebook Data on Amazon Cloud Servers Wasn't Hard, UpGuard's Vickery Says
text: Chris Vickery, director of cyber risk research at UpGuard, discusses his firm's discovery of publicly posted Facebook Inc. user data on Amazon.com Inc.

title: These are LinkedIn's top companies to work for in 2019
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team talks with Dan Roth, LinkedIn editor-in-chief, about the the platform's new survey of the top companies in 2019.

title: Facebook dips on report that user records were exposed on Amazon cloud servers
text: Researchers from the cybersecurity firm UpGuard found that Facebook user account information was exposed on Amazon cloud servers.

title: Facebook User Data Records Found on Amazon Cloud
text: Researchers at UpGuard, a cybersecurity firm, found troves of user information hiding in plain sight, inadvertently posted publicly on Amazon.com Inc.’s cloud computing servers.

title: S&P 500 at highest level since October 9

title: Boeing, Facebook, AT&T And Amazon : Four Riddles Wrapped In An Enigma
text: I’m not sure anymore how it exactly happened, but I’ve got 25% of my assets in Boeing, Facebook, AT&T and Amazon.

title: Facebook: Value Investment For Growth Investors With 25%+ Upside
text: Even though the stock has regained a part of the losses, the discounted cash flow analysis points to further growth potential since Facebook has positioned itself to reap the benefits of one of the biggest and fastest growing sectors in the world.

title: Chart Pro: Facebook Could See More Gains
text: Shares of Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) closed above the $172 level Tuesday, which is an encouraging bullish indicator according to Miller Tabak's Matt Maley.

title: Facebook fallout? Is regulation coming?
